stepAnswer: Yes, a matrix with an entire row of zeros can have one solution if the system is consistent.
stepTitle: Can a matrix that has $$0$$ entries for an entire row have one solution?
choices: No, a matrix with an entire row of zeros cannot have one solution.
Yes, a matrix with a row of zeros always leads to a dependent system with one solution.
Yes, a matrix with an entire row of zeros can have one solution if the system is consistent.
No, the row of zeros always means the system has no solution.
